ad-blocking-tasks.title: No long tasks blocking ad-related network requests
ad-blocking-tasks.failureTitle: Avoid long tasks that block ad-related network requests
ad-blocking-tasks.description: Tasks blocking the main thread can delay ad requests and cause a poor user experience. Consider removing long blocking tasks or moving them off of the main thread. These tasks can be especially detrimental to performance on less powerful devices. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#long_tasks_are_blocking_ad-related_network_requests).

ad-render-blocking-resources.title: Minimal render-blocking resources found
ad-render-blocking-resources.description: Render-blocking resources slow down tag load times. Consider loading critical JS/CSS inline or loading scripts asynchronously or loading the tag earlier in the head. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/lighthouse/audits/blocking-resources).
ad-render-blocking-resources.failureDisplayValue: Up to %s s tag load time improvement

ad-request-critical-path.title: Minimal requests found in ad critical path
ad-request-critical-path.failureTitle: Reduce critical path for ad loading
ad-request-critical-path.description: Consider reducing the number of resources, loading multiple resources simultaneously, or loading resources earlier to improve ad speed. Requests that block ad loading can be found below. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#there_are_resources_blocking_the_first_ad_request).

ad-request-from-page-start.title: Latency of first ad request
ad-request-from-page-start.failureTitle: Reduce latency of first ad request
ad-request-from-page-start.description: This metric measures the elapsed time from the start of page load until the first ad request is made. Delayed ad requests will decrease impressions and viewability, and have a negative impact on ad revenue. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#reduce_tag_load_time_latency_of_first_ad_request_measurements).

ad-request-from-tag-load.title: Latency of first ad request, from tag load
ad-request-from-tag-load.failureTitle: Reduce latency of first ad request (from tag load)
ad-request-from-tag-load.description: This metric measures the elapsed time from when the Google Publisher Tag loads until the first ad request is made. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#reduce_tag_load_time_latency_of_first_ad_request_measurements).

ad-top-of-viewport.title: No ad found at the very top of the viewport
ad-top-of-viewport.failureTitle: Move the top ad further down the page
ad-top-of-viewport.description: Over 10% of ads are never viewed because users scroll past them before they become viewable. By moving ad slots away from the very top of the viewport, users are more likely to see ads before scrolling away. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#top_ad_is_too_high_in_viewport).
ad-top-of-viewport.failureDisplayValue: A scroll of %s px would hide half of your topmost ad

ads-in-viewport.title: Few or no ads loaded outside viewport
ads-in-viewport.failureTitle: Avoid loading ads until they are nearly on-screen
ads-in-viewport.description: Too many ads loaded outside the viewport lowers viewability rates and impacts user experience. Consider loading ads below the fold lazily as the user scrolls down. Consider using GPT's [Lazy Loading API](https://developers.google.com/doubleclick-gpt/reference#googletag.PubAdsService_enableLazyLoad). [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#there_are_eager_ads_loaded_outside_viewport).

async-ad-tags.title: GPT tag is loaded asynchronously
async-ad-tags.description: Loading the GPT tag synchronously blocks content rendering until the tag is fetched and loaded. Consider using the `async` attribute to load gpt.js asynchronously. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#gpt_tag_is_loaded_synchronously).

duplicate-tags.title: No duplicate tags found in any frame
duplicate-tags.failureTitle: Load tags only once per frame
duplicate-tags.description: Loading a tag more than once in the same frame is redundant and adds overhead without benefit. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#there_are_duplicate_tags_loaded_in_the_same_frame).

first-ad-paint.title: Latency of first ad render
first-ad-paint.failureTitle: Reduce time to render first ad
first-ad-paint.description: This metric measures the time for the first ad iframe to paint from page navigation. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#reduce_tag_load_time_latency_of_first_ad_request_measurements).

full-width-slots.title: Ad slots effectively use horizontal space
full-width-slots.failureTitle: Increase the width of ad slots
full-width-slots.description: Ad slots that utilize most of the page width generally experience increased click-through rate over smaller ad sizes. We recommend leaving no more than 25% of the viewport width unutilized on mobile devices.

idle-network-times.title: [Experimental] Network is efficiently utilized before ad requests
idle-network-times.failureTitle: [Experimental] Reduce network idle time before ad requests
idle-network-times.description: Moments of network idleness in the critical path to ad loading present opportunities to improve speed. Consider eliminating long tasks, timeouts, waiting on load events, or synchronous resources to avoid idleness. Chrome DevTools can be used to discover what is causing network idleness. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/tools/chrome-devtools/evaluate-performance/reference).
idle-network-times.displayValue: %s s spent idle in critical path

loads-gpt-from-sgdn.title: GPT tag is loaded from recommended host
loads-gpt-from-sgdn.description: Load GPT from 'securepubads.g.doubleclick.net' to reduce GPT load time. By loading GPT from the same host as ad requests, browsers can avoid an additional DNS lookup and HTTP connection. Example:`<script async src="https://securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/tag/js/gpt.js">`. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#load_gpt_from_recommended_host).

loads-gpt-over-https.title: GPT tag is loaded over HTTPS
loads-gpt-over-https.description: For privacy and security, always load GPT over HTTPS. Insecure pages should explicitly request the GPT script securely. Example:`<script async src="https://securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/tag/js/gpt.js">`. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#gpt_tag_is_loaded_insecurely).

script-injected-tags.title: No script-injected tags found
script-injected-tags.description: Load scripts directly with `<script async src=...>` instead of injecting scripts with JavaScript. This allows the browser fetch the script sooner. [Learn more](https://www.igvita.com/2014/05/20/script-injected-async-scripts-considered-harmful/).

serial-header-bidding.title: Header bidding is parallelized
serial-header-bidding.description: Send header bidding requests simultaneously, rather than serially, to retrieve bids more quickly. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#there_are_serial_header_bidding_requests).

static-ad-tags.title: GPT tag is loaded statically
static-ad-tags.description: Tags loaded dynamically are not visible to the browser preloader. Consider using a static tag or `<link rel="preload">` so the browser may load GPT sooner. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#gpt_tag_is_loaded_dynamically).
static-ad-tags.failureDisplayValue: Up to %s s tag load time improvement

tag-load-time.title: Tag load time
tag-load-time.description: This metric measures the time for the Google Publisher Tag's implementation script (pubads_impl.js) to load after the page loads. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#reduce_tag_load_time_latency_of_first_ad_request_measurements).

viewport-ad-density.title: Ad density in initial viewport is within recommended range
viewport-ad-density.failureTitle: Reduce ad density in initial viewport
viewport-ad-density.description: The ads-to-content ratio inside the viewport can have an impact on user experience and ultimately user retention. The Better Ads Standard [recommends having an ad density below 30%](https://www.betterads.org/mobile-ad-density-higher-than-30/). [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/publisher-ads-audits/reference/audits#ad_density_inside_viewport_is_higher_than_recommended).

NOT_APPLICABLE.NO_VALID_AD_WIDTHS: No requested ads contain ads of valid width

ERRORS.AREA_LARGER_THAN_VIEWPORT: Calculated ad area is larger than viewport

WARNINGS.NO_ADS: No ads were requested when fetching this page.
WARNINGS.NO_AD_RENDERED: No ads were painted when rendering this page.
WARNINGS.NO_TAG: The GPT tag was not requested.
